page.title: 14COMMERCIAL ENTERPRISES
page.content: There are three commercial enterprises in the area other than farming.The largest being Spains Hall Tree Nursery ,owned by Timothy Ruggles-Brise.The nursery covers approximately nine acres of land where young trees are grown for both timber and conservation purposes.The entrance to the nursery is the B1053 road,next to Clock House Farm,Little Sampford.On the road from Great Bardfield to Little Sampford at Hawkspur Green,stands Brook house. Alongside is a small company, managed by Thomas Cooper,haulage contracter.Six people are employed. Lastly Mr & Mrs Dines,Great Bardfield run a newspaper service from home. Apart from delivering papers in the area,a kiosk standing in the drive displays magazines,daily & Sunday newspapers for sale.An 'honesty'box is outside for customers to leave money.
